title: Possibility of DOS Through logging System

profile.name: Quora
profile.about: A place to share knowledge and better understand the world.

vulnerability_information:
The Quora is using HTTP post method to send logs to the Quora Server and save the logs on the server 
Which is not Validating the size of the log data and directly storing a large amount of data on the server.
i mean when the logs are sended to the server a bad guy can use the same HTTP POST method and same Parameter to send a large amount of data to your server because there is no Mechanism to Test incoming logs size and attacker can  fill a large amount of space  on the server.

How To Reproduce:

Normal HTTP Request:

POST https://log.quora.com/ajax/batched_log_POST HTTP/1.1
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 1328
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Origin: https://www.quora.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/55.0.2883.87 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Referer: https://www.quora.com/
Accept-Language: en-gb
Cookie: m-b="HmerlxRPKlY2P8ZetSoJRA\075\075"; m-s="fApMTrywJ0FDK7OlbICFPg\075\075"; m-css_v=d4987ef9da8d042b; m-login=1; m-early_v=ad51054ba26a785a; m-tz=-330; m-wf-loaded=q-icons-q_serif; _ga=GA1.2.1732973717.1498176387; _gid=GA1.2.1110816896.1498176387
Host: log.quora.com

json=%7B%22args%22%3A%5B%5D%2C%22kwargs%22%3A%7B%22messages%22%3A%5B%7B%22category%22%3A%22action_data%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22data%22%3A%7B%22url%22%3A%22%2Fwebnode2%2Fserver_call_POST%3F_v%3DT8XhSYsCyYcwrs%26_m%3Dget_next_page%22%2C%22vcon%22%3A%5B%22T8XhSYsCyYcwrs%22%5D%2C%22method%22%3A%22get_next_page%22%2C%22args%22%3Anull%2C%22kwargs%22%3Anull%2C%22startTime%22%3A1498176435253%2C%22id%22%3A%22er24r3s3oi%22%2C%22controller%22%3A%22webnode2%22%2C%22action%22%3A%22server_call_POST%22%2C%22standard%22%3A%7B%7D%2C%22serverTime%22%3A2552628%2C%22endTime%22%3A1498176439423%7D%7D%2C%22time%22%3A1498176439423000%7D%2C%7B%22category%22%3A%22perf%2Fpost_e2e%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22vcon%22%3A%5B%22T8XhSYsCyYcwrs%22%5D%2C%22method%22%3A%22get_next_page%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22web%22%2C%22duration%22%3A4436%7D%2C%22time%22%3A1498176439690000%7D%2C%7B%22category%22%3A%22perf%2Fpost_e2e%22%2C%22data%22%3A%7B%22vcon%22%3A%5B%22T8XhSYsCyYcwrs%22%5D%2C%22method%22%3A%22get_next_page%22%2C%22type%22%3A%22user_perceived%22%2C%22duration%22%3A4436%7D%2C%22time%22%3A1498176439690000%7D%5D%2C%22nid%22%3A0%7D%7D&revision=7a0b4942858186e883835568054f3089311f25c1&formkey=c990bafe6dcaaf22d5939994fc0a2bca&postkey=42e50148a09db5abeef10502c90ea3ce&window_id=dep3101-4180021445674349298&referring_controller=index&referring_action=index

-->End of The Request<--

the Parameter json= carries a data which is url encoded

Attacker can encode His Payload of large size [say 2.0 MB ] and paste in the HTTP Request and send to the server and server is Successfully Accepting the Request and Saveing his large amount of data [2.0 mb] on your server.
This time the hacker can send this http request 1000000 times to fill up whole memory on the server and cause the server to crash or slow down.


POC

in Video i have showed a little Description how Hackers can Perform a Delicious Attack using quora Log System !
vulnerability_information_html:
The Quora is using HTTP post method to send logs to the Quora Server and save the logs on the server
Which is not Validating the size of the log data and directly storing a large amount of data on the server.
i mean when the logs are sended to the server a bad guy can use the same HTTP POST method and same Parameter to send a large amount of data to your server because there is no Mechanism to Test incoming logs size and attacker can fill a large amount of space on the server.

How To Reproduce:

Normal HTTP Request:

POST https://log.quora.com/ajax/batched_log_POST HTTP/1.1
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 1328
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, /; q=0.01
Origin: https://www.quora.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/55.0.2883.87 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8

activities.message:
Can you send this video as an unlisted youtube video instead of an attachment?

We have limits on the payload and other restrictions. We also do not process this in memory so there should be no impact on the memory of the server.

activities.message: Thanks for taking the time to upload this ti youtube. We discard message above a certain limit. And we also parse the message that are within that limit and only store data we are looking for. So sending large amounts of these requests are gracefully handled.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for taking the time to upload this ti youtube. We discard message above a certain limit. And we also parse the message that are within that limit and only store data we are looking for. So sending large amounts of these requests are gracefully handled.

activities.message:
Actually there is no limit how much data a attacker can send is one HTTP request !!
i think this is a valid security issue !
activities.markdown_message:
Actually there is no limit how much data a attacker can send is one HTTP request !!
i think this is a valid security issue !

activities.message:
How Can You claim That the server is Protected and large amounts of these requests are gracefully handled when i am able to send a large no. of requests to the server without any error and am able to consume a large amount of space on the server

it clearly shows that there is no mechanism for  

-> Checking Amount of Data in the HTTP request comming from the client
->Flood of HTTP requests containg too much of data which is been stored on the server


PROOF
====

How i sended a large no. of Requests to the server with each 500 KB payload

Consuming
500*30 = 15000 KB of Data on The Server

activities.message: Sorry for the delay. The limit are on the server. I am not sure what you mean by "consume a large amount of space on the server" the server process each request and discards data that is not in the correct shape. So there is no space used on the server.
activities.markdown_message: Sorry for the delay. The limit are on the server. I am not sure what you mean by "consume a large amount of space on the server" the server process each request and discards data that is not in the correct shape. So there is no space used on the server.

activities.message:
Only Checking The Shape of The Request in Not enough.

Letus take an example Your server had Conditions:

--> Your Webserver receaves logs from json= parameter in correct shape.
--> Log Data should be url Encoded
if These conditions matchs the server saves the Accepts The Request and Saves the logs 


Now if I am satisfying Both the conditions

--> i  will send logs in correct shape in json= parameter
--> I will send html encoded data

but i will send too much of data to the webserver to Eat up more space on The Server.
because the server is validating the logs for proper shape but not for proper size.

Example:
=====

Normal Request -[Proper shape and Small size (say example 50 kb)

URL ENCODED:
%22url%22%3A%22%2Fwebnode2%2Fserver_call_POST%3F_v%3DT8XhSYsCyYcwrs%26_m%3Dget_next_page%0D%0A

URL DECODED
"url":"/webnode2/server_call_POST?_v=T8XhSYsCyYcwrs&_m=get_next_page


My Payload -[proper Shape but size is too much (say 500 kb)]

URL ENCODED
%22url%22%3A%22%2Fwebnode2%2Fserver_call_POST%3F_v%3DT8XhSYsCimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranyYcwrs%26_m%3Dget_next_page

URL DECODED
"url":"/webnode2/server_call_POST?_v=T8XhSYsCimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranyYcwrs&_m=get_next_page



so if i will send MY PAYLOAD in URL ENCODED form Your server will check for Shape of The request which is Proper 
and will save the log to the server but i will not check that the data i am receaving and saving is too much so it will consume much space on the server if Attacker can sended 10-10000000K requests per day  and server will save.

Please Let me know if Your are Facing Difficulty to Understand This Bug ?

have a Good Day 
Thankuu !
activities.markdown_message:
Only Checking The Shape of The Request in Not enough.

Letus take an example Your server had Conditions:

--> Your Webserver receaves logs from json= parameter in correct shape.
--> Log Data should be url Encoded
if These conditions matchs the server saves the Accepts The Request and Saves the logs

Now if I am satisfying Both the conditions

--> i will send logs in correct shape in json= parameter
--> I will send html encoded data

but i will send too much of data to the webserver to Eat up more space on The Server.
because the server is validating the logs for proper shape but not for proper size.

Example:

Normal Request -[Proper shape and Small size (say example 50 kb)

URL ENCODED:
%22url%22%3A%22%2Fwebnode2%2Fserver_call_POST%3F_v%3DT8XhSYsCyYcwrs%26_m%3Dget_next_page%0D%0A

URL DECODED
"url":"/webnode2/server_call_POST?_v=T8XhSYsCyYcwrs&_m=get_next_page

My Payload -[proper Shape but size is too much (say 500 kb)]

URL ENCODED
%22url%22%3A%22%2Fwebnode2%2Fserver_call_POST%3F_v%3DT8XhSYsCimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranyYcwrs%26_m%3Dget_next_page

URL DECODED
"url":"/webnode2/server_call_POST?_v=T8XhSYsCimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranimraimranyYcwrs&_m=get_next_page

so if i will send MY PAYLOAD in URL ENCODED form Your server will check for Shape of The request which is Proper
and will save the log to the server but i will not check that the data i am receaving and saving is too much so it will consume much space on the server if Attacker can sended 10-10000000K requests per day and server will save.

Please Let me know if Your are Facing Difficulty to Understand This Bug ?

have a Good Day
Thankuu !

activities.message:
"if These conditions matchs the server saves the Accepts The Request and Saves the logs" - this assumption is false. We don't store these.

Also correct shape not just url encode.
activities.markdown_message:
"if These conditions matchs the server saves the Accepts The Request and Saves the logs" - this assumption is false. We don't store these.

Also correct shape not just url encode.

activities.message:
Can we ReOpen The Post as i discussed this issue with some security researchers and they told me that its a valid issue:
let me explain a little bit
Logs can introduce a Denial of Service condition if they are not properly stored. Any attacker with sufficient resources could
be able to produce a sufficient number of requests that would fill up the allocated space to log files, if they are not
specifically prevented from doing so. the log files will be stored in the
same disk partition as the one used for the operating system software or the application itself. This means that if the disk
were to be filled up the operating system or the application might fail because it is unable to write on disk.
Typically in UNIX systems logs will be located in /var (although some server installations might reside in /opt or /usr/local)

in order to prevent the system logs from being affected, the log directory of the server software itself (such as
/var/log/apache in the Apache web server) should be stored in a dedicated partition.
This is not to say that logs should be allowed to grow to fill up the file system they reside in. Growth of server logs should
be monitored in order to detect this condition since it may be indicative of an attack.
activities.markdown_message:
Can we ReOpen The Post as i discussed this issue with some security researchers and they told me that its a valid issue:
let me explain a little bit
Logs can introduce a Denial of Service condition if they are not properly stored. Any attacker with sufficient resources could
be able to produce a sufficient number of requests that would fill up the allocated space to log files, if they are not
specifically prevented from doing so. the log files will be stored in the
same disk partition as the one used for the operating system software or the application itself. This means that if the disk
were to be filled up the operating system or the application might fail because it is unable to write on disk.
Typically in UNIX systems logs will be located in /var (although some server installations might reside in /opt or /usr/local)

in order to prevent the system logs from being affected, the log directory of the server software itself (such as
/var/log/apache in the Apache web server) should be stored in a dedicated partition.
This is not to say that logs should be allowed to grow to fill up the file system they reside in. Growth of server logs should
be monitored in order to detect this condition since it may be indicative of an attack.
